alert.note: Alert for Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 11:33AM MST until February 21 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow and flash freeze possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches possible, 6 to 12 in the Mission and Swan ranges. Quickly dropping temperatures will be capable of freezing road surfaces on Sunday afternoon and evening. Gusty easterly winds on could create blowing snow conditions, making travel difficult. * WHERE...Highway 200 Bonner to Greenough, Highway 83 Seeley Lake to Condon, and I-90 East Missoula to Bearmouth. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be affected. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
